definition: to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
settled/steady/stable
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)

sentences.chinese: 照马司模所言，那就是“我们要在这里站稳脚跟”。

sentences.english: The firm won't regain its footing until the economy rebounds.
sentences.chinese: 直到经济反弹之前该公司都无法站稳脚跟。

sentences.english: Flexible non-slip outsole is durable and textured for sure footing with each step.
sentences.chinese: 灵活的防滑大底是耐用和质感的每一步站稳脚跟。

sentences.english: back when America was first getting its feet and like, started to write its own literature.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候的美国刚刚站稳脚跟准备创作自己的文学。

sentences.english: Flexible non-slip PU outsole is durable and textured for sure footing with each step.
sentences.chinese: 灵活的防滑PU大底是耐用和质感的每一步站稳脚跟。

to stand firm

lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to march/to advance

lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback

to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
